H0.text: People fishing from a boat most likely damage the nests of the piping plover, which builds its nest on sand dunes along the Atlantic Ocean.

H1.text: Children playing in the ocean waves are the action that most likely damages the nests of the piping plover, a bird that builds its nest on sand dunes along the Atlantic Ocean.

H2.text: Children digging holes along the sand dunes most likely damage the nests of the piping plover, which builds its nest on sand dunes along the Atlantic Ocean.

H3.text: People walking on a sidewalk along the sand dunes most likely damages the nests of the piping plover, which builds its nests on sand dunes along the Atlantic Ocean.

A4.text: The most significant cause of nest failure in piping plovers on Long Island was not humans, but depredation by the Red fox.

A5.text: Piping plovers are much less likely to successfully fledge in heavily trafficked, popular recreational areas.
